page.title: 01Farmland around Sawdon
page.content: Mainly flattish rolling farmland on the southern edge of the North York Moors National park as it gives way to the intensively farmed Vale of Pickering. Mainly arable farmland quite varied with many hedgerows and trees so quite pleasant scenery. The north borders on the large forestry coniferous plantations of Wykham forest as wellas deciduous woods along Sawdon Beck. The south west around Wydale Hall is also deciduous woods, and parkland. There are two small villages, Sawdon and Ruston which are small, mainly farming communities with few amenities. Most residents are thus involved in farming, or else retired, or commuters to nearby towns. There is a large builders supplier near Sawdon. The area probably attracts some visitors but as more spectacular scenery
